transcripts.text: But to me, I think a story that we have to highlight is this ongoing masquerade that we are being inundated with.  And again, I am not anti-mask.  I don't believe any of us has a right to not be inconvenienced during extraordinary times like, say, the worst pandemic in a century or at least the worst since the Hong Kong flu a half a century ago.  I don't think we're entitled to not be inconvenienced when matters of public health are at stake.  I don't.  I do think, though, we are entitled to the truth.  I think we're entitled to real science, not junk science, not scientism,
